page.title: 01HESSLE & ANLABY:INTRODUCTION
page.content: Housing in this area is very varied.In Anlaby there are mainly postwar or inter-war semi-detached houses whereas in Hessle there are older terraced houses. Both are typical suburban middle-class areas. Leisure facilities are sparse but have been recently improved by the building of Hessle Library which,due to its vast size, attracts people from the vicinity, including Hull. The only other facilities available are bowling greens and numerous pubs. The dominant land cover to the west is arable farming with scattered plant nurseries. Industry is found on the very outskirts of the urban settlement,particularly around Anlaby, and consists of light manufacturing firms. The road network is fairly complex with several inter-connecting routes and a main arterial road.
